column5: Ill probably opt out for a stick since I can use that against people/pets/coyotes. Anything dangerous when im out walking. Im a pretty short petite girl at 5â€1â€™

Same for me. He and I had many firsts in the last 8 years weâ€™ve been together. We were so in love, I was so in love.

I sacrificed so much, so many situations that I risked for for him. Putting him first in everything, because I had complete faith and trust that he loved me just as much as I love him.

Until 1.5yrs later heâ€™s now unsure. He wants to try to make it work still, to reignite the flame. The only career (seriously, I was only exposed to 1) growing up was medical field. I grew up with the mentality that I was gonna be a nurse because my whole family consists of CNAâ€™s, RNâ€™s, & Phlebotomists. Plus im emotionally soft ğŸ¥´ My heart cant handle such a hard labor, emotional job. 

That being said, Im now 22. The age were classmates start graduating with bachelors degrees 4yrs after high school. Im here still clueless about a career choice, id hate to waste money on a degree I wont use. That pressure from the family, the disgrace you feel, feeling left behind. Its tough.

This is so true. Its especially true in my culture as an asian because depression is thought of as taboo. Having a child with depression makes them think its the absolute end of the world, that theyâ€™ve got a ruined child and theyâ€™ve failed in raising me as my parent.
